PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [118b2fe326](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20518/commits/118b2fe326197bd546f1c3d3598a485719917483)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`-+-+ algebra'`
`-+-+-+ algebra`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4816|-1|porting notes|

Current commit [118b2fe326](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/118b2fe326197bd546f1c3d3598a485719917483)
Reference commit [7466910ec3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/7466910ec32964324f989f7c7bcb0a807a895417)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/49c0a5a5-f9c5-4593-820f-c15333f071cc) for commit 2890b284f02442682dc8f96f43dd8195e0d72980.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/693b816f-aa28-43b8-9f82-5ba14e6bedb1) for commit e85e968a7bed7313c6f682e28fc53a8015f8dc22.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/9aab7f8e-29c7-41de-98d0-6cac68f7c5dd) for commit 6fb5948c8371e9bc06978b646872a70bdad905cf.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/9aab7f8e-29c7-41de-98d0-6cac68f7c5dd) for commit 6fb5948c8371e9bc06978b646872a70bdad905cf.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

I should say that I have no particular suspicion that mathlib will compile more quickly or more slowly, but I thought it was worth benchmarking giving that we're changing such a fundamental definition and that typeclass inference can sometimes be very delicate. I hadn't realised that there were problems with the benchmarking bot.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/241bd3e0-cd9f-43a3-91c5-b85d69eb08de) for commit 02cc50f7a56404154355d99724623db4069b1137.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/68fb6b54-e226-41ab-aa47-75effd0e0795/to/241bd3e0-cd9f-43a3-91c5-b85d69eb08de) against commit 7466910ec32964324f989f7c7bcb0a807a895417.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-4.214‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.00%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.CotangentComplex`|+1.883‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.67%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.JacobiZariski`|-2.397‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-0.28%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12735991050)
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kbuzzard.

:v: edegeltje can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+
bors r+
Already running a review

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12748033780/job/35527345156)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12748033780/job/35527345465)

maintainer delegate

I am not an expert in the finer parts of typeclass inference so I'd like another maintainer to sign off on this, but it's great to see that this change decreases build time a little and the diff looks fine to me (github is making much more of a meal of it than it could do).
bors d+

maintainer delegate

I am not an expert in the finer parts of typeclass inference so I'd like another maintainer to sign off on this, but it's great to see that this change decreases build time a little and the diff looks fine to me (github is making much more of a meal of it than it could do).
bors d+
Looks like you are adding `with toFun x := x` to achieve a certain syntactic equality, not just defeq. Is it necessary for not breaking certain proofs or does it have a performance impact?
`toFun` was already overriden in the previous implementation. i don't know its purpose, i just maintained the design.
Oh I missed it, thanks!
I think this is because instances are supposed to be reducible, but `RingHom.id` is not.

There's some inconsistency in how you write these brackets: I personally prefer
```suggestion
  algebraMap :=
  { toFun s := coe (algebraMap S R s)
    map_one' := by simp only [map_one, coe_one]
    map_zero' := by simp only [map_zero, coe_zero]
    map_mul' x y := by simp only [map_mul, coe_mul]
    map_add' x y := by simp only [map_add, coe_add] }
```
good catch, i'll go through it and try to make it all match your suggestion.
For example here you use a different format for the closing }.
This should include a remark that `algebraMap` in the root namespace should be used instead.
This porting note is kind of a lie now, maybe it's time to just remove it? It's now about a structure which no longer exists.
I agree the porting note can be removed, but I am not sure what the structure which no longer exists refers to: `ContMDiffMap.semiring` still seems to exist...
Is the `Module.compHom` thing on line 66 still necessary?
I believe it is. There's `Algebra.compHom` that can replace the whole def now but this is probably not in scope of the PR.
PR at #20708

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/Algebra/Defs): add an `algebraMap` field to `Algebra` instead of extending `RingHom`
